Method Detail

addListener

void addListener(IDominoListener listener)
Adds an implementation of IDominoListener to the object. Listeners are used to run code when a certain event occurs.

Parameters:
listener - a class implementing IDominoListener and running code for an EnumEvent in the eventHappened method
Since:
org.openntf.domino 3.0.0

removeListener

void removeListener(IDominoListener listener)
Removes an implementation of IDominoListener from the object, ensuring the listener will not trigger in the future

Parameters:
listener - a class implementing IDominoListener listening for an EnumEvent
Since:
org.openntf.domino 3.0.0

getListeners

java.util.List<IDominoListener> getListeners()
Gets the list of implementations of IDominoListener assigned to the object

Returns:
List a list of classes implementing IDominoListener
Since:
org.openntf.domino 3.0.0

getListeners

java.util.List<IDominoListener> getListeners(EnumEvent event)
Loops through all implementations of IDominoListener assigned to the object and creates a List of all that listen for a specific event, e.g. Events.AFTER_CREATE_DOCUMENT

Parameters:
event - EnumEvent to check for in each class implementing IDominoListener, calling their getEventTypes method
Returns:
List a list of class implementing IDominoListener that listen for the specific EnumEvent
Since:
org.openntf.domino 3.0.0

fireListener

boolean fireListener(IDominoEvent event)
Loops through all listeners calling their eventHappened methods, passing the relevant event

Parameters:
event - IDominoEvent containing an EnumEvent, source, target and payload
Returns:
boolean success or failure of running the associated event code
Since:
org.openntf.domino 3.0.0
